item.title: Compress files to Zip with Powershell
item.description: I have seen a lot of people writing PowerShell scripts to compress files or folders by using external file compression programs. Often Winrar, 7-Zip or something similar is used since PowerShell does not have any built in cmdlet to do this (not until version 5 at least). There is however a pretty simple way of doing this with only PowerShell. This is how. # First we add the .Net framework class needed for file compression.
